intro: Pseudosantalum miquelii, commonly known as the Miquel's ghost tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its unique, woody structure and evergreen foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
